LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Hippopotamus.label: hippopotamus leather
LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Hippopotamus.description: A thick leather of a hippopotamus. Not only it's extremely durable, but it also provides considerable heat insulation.
LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Wildebeest.label: wildebeest pelt
LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Wildebeest.description: A thick but crumbly wildebeest fur and leather. Whilst it provides some degree of damage protection, the overall longevity of the item decreases.
LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Platypus.label: platypus leather
LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Platypus.description: Platypus fur was considered a valuable commodity in the days of old Terra, a fact that almost drove the Platypus to extinction. Luckily, the animal was protected and thrived again.
LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Lion.label: lion pelt
LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Lion.description: A strong, luxurious leather of the leader of the animal kingdom. Often sought after by urbworld philanthropists.
LanguageData.WoolCamel.label: camel wool
LanguageData.WoolCamel.description: Camel's wool. It provides good insulation from heat.
LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Pinniped.label: pinniped leather
LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Pinniped.description: Tanned and dried leather from a Pinniped. It is of average strength but insulates well against heat.
LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Tiger.label: tiger leather
LanguageData.AEXP_Leather_Tiger.description: Tigers were often the target of poachers in old Earth due to their luxurious pelts, a fact that almost drove them to extinction. With the near lawlessness of the Rim, tiger leather is seen as another exotic commodity to trade between settlements.
LanguageData.AEXP_MuskOxWool.label: musk ox wool
LanguageData.AEXP_MuskOxWool.description: The inner wool of the muskox, originally known in Inuktitut as Qiviuq. Stronger and warmer than sheep's wool, and softer than cashmere wool.
